definition[0]: to trick a person or organization in order to get money from them
example[0]: He faces charges of theft and conspiracy to defraud  (=a secret plan to cheat someone, made by two or more people).
example[1]: She defrauded her employers of thousands of pounds.
definition[1]: to gain money or goods from someone by saying or doing something dishonest
example[2]: He admitted attempting to defraud the insurance company.
